communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the New York Freedom of Information Law, I hereby request the following records:

All letters, emails, and documents related to Attorney General Eric Schneiderman's 2014 request for information regarding "on call shifts" at retailers such as Abercrombie & Fitch, Gap, Target, and TJX Companies.

This request is being made for non-commercial research purposes and the requested documents will be made available to the general public.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer that the request be filled electronically by e-mail attachment if possible.

Thank you for your assistance with this request. I look forward to receiving your response within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Peter Fugiel
Postdoctoral Research Fellow
Rutgers School of Management & Labor Relations

title: Rockledge, Florida: Language directed at police

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Florida Sunshine Law, I hereby request the following records:

A copy of any police report (including any records referenced in the report, such as photographs, body camera recordings, or other records) concerning any alleged violation of Sec. 13-5(22) ("Any person who insults any police officer on the streets, public roads or other places while in the performance of his lawful duties or who makes derogatory or insulting remarks either to or about any police officer, or makes any sign, motion or gesture calculated to insult or humiliate such police officer or officers"). That ordinance may be located at https://library.municode.com/fl/rockledge/codes/code_of_ordinances?nodeId=PTIICOOR_CH13OFMIPR_S13-5DICO.

This request is limited to records generated on or after January 1, 2010.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days.

Sincerely,

Adam Steinbaugh

title: Van Buren Township, Michigan: Language directed at police

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Michigan Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

A copy of any police report (including any records referenced in the report, such as photographs, body camera recordings, or other records) concerning any alleged violation of Sec. 58-37 (Use of vulgar or obscene language in presence of law enforcement agent). That ordinance may be located at https://library.municode.com/mi/van_buren_charter_township,_(wayne_co.)/codes/code_of_ordinances?nodeId=COOR_CH58OFMIPR_ARTIIOFAFGOFU_S58-37USVUOBLAPRLAENAG. 

This request is limited to records generated on or after January 1, 2010.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Adam Steinbaugh

title: City of Edmond, OK: Sign ordinance

communications.subject: Oklahoma Open Records Act Request: City of Edmond, OK: Sign ordinance
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Oklahoma Open Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

A copy of any police report (including any records referenced in the report, such as photographs, body camera recordings, or other records) concerning any alleged violation of Ordinance 8.12.080 or "displaying insulting signs."

This request is limited to records generated on or after January 1, 2010.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days.

Sincerely,

Adam Steinbaugh

To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Georgia Open Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

A copy of any police report, incident report, or other records concerning any enforcement of Ordinance No. 36-80 ("No signs shall be displayed that are rude, vulgar or obscene or offensive and no slogans, [chants] or songs shall be permitted that are rude, vulgar, obscene or offensive." 

This is limited to records generated on or after January 1, 2010.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 3 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Adam Steinbaugh

communications.subject: Oregon Public Records Law Request: Vehicular Pursuit Policy (Oregon State Police)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Oregon Public Records Law, I hereby request the following records:

All current policies maintained by the department regarding vehicle pursuits (also known as: car chase, vehicular response policy, vehicular pursuit procedure, fleet crashes).

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days.

Sincerely,

Sydnee Coggins-Prioleau

communications.subject: RE: Oregon Public Records Law Request: Vehicular Pursuit Policy (Oregon State Police)

If you are not the addressee or it appears from the context or otherwise that you have received this e-mail in error, please advise me immediately by reply e-mail, keep the contents confidential, and immediately delete the message and any attachments from your system.
